TopicTitle: Why have they stopped posting show an tells

Articles.Content:
15 minutes ago, gussi111 said:

for what?

They are being cynical, the release of halo Infinite does not have an impact at all and they are comparing it to us talking about the game awards, with the implication that those don’t make a difference either. I don’t now about the game awards so I can’t tell if they could have a reveal or not.

30 minutes ago, t_v said:

They are being cynical, the release of halo Infinite does not have an impact at all and they are comparing it to us talking about the game awards, with the implication that those don’t make a difference either. I don’t now about the game awards so I can’t tell if they could have a reveal or not. 

Thank you for explaining!

I will refrain my feeling, that if they develop and publish by 2025, they are ahead of the average curve for game development, and kudos.  Not fiscal year 2025 either, but the actual year.  

I'm not certain why companies insist on telling customers the fiscal year they're releasing in, as most customers tend to measure wait times in the actual calendar year.   I know it is industry standard, but we don't celebrate the New Year in a few weeks by saying "Happy 2023" and also?    Why are there still pennies.  They no longer make cents.  Fortunately, it appears they'll have modeled clouds for me to shake my fist at over pennies when this comes out.  

Also, are they going to model the Yeet 3000 spinning launcher?

Edited December 10, 2021 by Bosun

17 hours ago, gussi111 said:

for what?

A game getting delayed, living up to the hype, and being great.
Sorry for misconstruing your previous statement, I should not have assumed your intent.

Well, I can’t see anything here. Unless someone finds something on another platform, I don’t think they posted anything today. 
 

Edit: sorry, the team just posted something. It is in dev diaries

Edited December 10, 2021 by t_v

OH WAIT NO I MISSED IT

Dev Insights 12 is up!
